gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Lead dissolved from the U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Dissolved Pb data from US GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect Dataset Description: <p>Dissolved lead concentrations of the transect in samples taken from the GEOTRACES GO-FLO rosette surface casts and filtered through a 0.2um Acropak capsule filter.</p><p>Access to these data are restricted until 2017 except for members of the US GEOTRACES program. Please contact the PI for further information.</p><p><strong>Related References:</strong></p><p>Bruland, K.W., E.L. Rue, G.J. Smith, and G.R. Ditullio (2005), Iron, macronutrients and diatom blooms in the Peru upwelling regime: brown and blue waters of Peru, Mar. Chem., 93, 81–103.</p><p>Cutter, G. A., and K. W. Bruland (2012), Rapid and noncontaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys, Linmol. Oceanogr. Methods, 10, 425- 436.</p><p>Ndung’u, K., R.P. Franks, K.W. Bruland, and A.R. Flegal (2003), Organic complexation and total dissolved trace metal analysis in estuarine waters: comparison of solvent-extraction graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometric and chelating resin flow injection inductively coupled plasma-mass spectrometric analysis, Anal. Chim. Ac., 481(1), 127-138.</p><p>Zurbrick, C. M., C. Gallon, A. R. Flegal. (2013). A new method for stable lead isotope extraction from seawater. Analytica Chimica Acta, 800, 29-35.</p><p>&nbsp;</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Sampling:</strong></p><p>Sample bottles were LDPE and cleaned in accordance with the GEOTRACES cookbook (<a href="http://www.geotraces.org/images/stories/documents/intercalibration/Cookbook.pdf">http://www.geotraces.org/images/stories/documents/intercalibration/Cookbook.pdf</a>). Sample bottles were stored in weak (~0.1 N) HNO<span style="font-size:10.8333px">3</span>, and were emptied before shipping.</p><p>Samples were collected using the U.S. GEOTRACES sampling system of 24 Teflon-coated GO-FLO bottles (Cutter and Bruland, 2012). At each station, the bottles were deployed open and tripped on ascent at 3 m/min. GO-FLOs were sampled in the GEOTRACES trace metal clean sampling van that contained HEPA-filtered air.</p><p>During sampling, the GO-FLO bottles were pressurized to ~0.4 atm with HEPA-filtered air, and their spigots were fitted with an acid-cleaned piece of Bev-a-Line tubing that fed into an Acropak-200 Supor capsule filter (0.2 µm pore size made of polyethersulfone). Before use, this filter had been filled with filtered surface seawater that had been acidifed to pH 2 with trace metal clean HCl and left overnight to rinse. Before collecting any subsamples, at least 500mL of seawater was passed through the filter (while eliminating air bubbles in the capsule reservoir). Sample bottles were rinsed three times with 10% sample volume before filling. Acropak filters were used for at most 3 casts before a new filter was used, and they were stored empty in a refrigerator while not in use. GEOFish surface samples were taken using an all-plastic "towed fish" pumping system as described in Bruland et al. 2005 at approximately 3 m depth and were similarly filtered and sampled.</p><p>Samples were acidified at sea with the equivalent of 4mL quartz-distilled 6M HCl per liter of seawater (resulting in pH 1.7-1.8). Samples were sitting acidified for several months before analysis back in the laboratory.</p><p><strong>Analysis:</strong></p><p>Samples were analyzed using the method of Ndung’u et. al. (2003) with adaptations from Zurbrick, et. al. (2013). Aliquots of samples are poured in to 15mL LDPE bottles for analysis. Samples, blanks, reference materials and standards are all treated equally. They are buffered with trace metal clean ammonium acetate (pH 9) in line and sent across a Toyopearl AF-Chelate 650 M resin column. The column is rinsed with diluted ammonium acetate, and eluted in 1.5N quartz distilled nitric acid (with added bismuth as an internal standard) into the injector of the HR-ICP-MS. Counts of lead are measured throughout the elution, yielding a curve which is then integrated to give our raw values.</p><p>Standards are made by spiking lead into low concentration seawater. Blanks are 24mL HCl in Milli-Q. Reference materials used were SAFe S1, SAFe D2, and GEOTRACES reference samples GS and GD. Standard curves are run at the beginning and the end of runs and reference materials and blanks are run throughout (every 10 or less samples).</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1234213 Award URL: http://nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1234213

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/647539.rdf Name: CTDDEPTH Units: meters Description: CTD bottle firing depth. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/647540.rdf Name: CTDPRS Units: meters Description: CTD pressure. gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cruise identifier.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: Unique cruise identifier.; General Description: Used as a unique identifier for a cruise. Usual generation formula is ICES 4 character platform code then the cruise departure date in YYYYMDD format. An underscore character may also be present.
PI-supplied Description: Station Number; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES Event Number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: latitude in decimal degrees at the start of the event (according to the EPZT event log); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: longitude in decimal degrees at the start of the event (according to the EPZT event log); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES sample number; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Sample depth as reported by PI.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved lead concentration as measured from the GeoFish sampler; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved lead concentration as measured from GO-FLO bottles; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.
PI-supplied Description: Cast Number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Bottle quality flag: 2 = good; 3 = questionable; 4 = bad; 9 = missing data. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: ISO 8601:2004 standard date and time at start of event. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:name: year, month, day, hour, minute, seconds

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD bottle firing depth. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: ODF CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: Saunders-Mantyla depth (integrated, uses dynamic height). Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Fofonoff-Millard depth (non-integrated). Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.
PI-supplied Description: Bottom depth. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water depth, in meters

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Sampling:</strong></p><p>Sample bottles were LDPE and cleaned in accordance with the GEOTRACES cookbook (<a href="http://www.geotraces.org/images/stories/documents/intercalibration/Cookbook.pdf">http://www.geotraces.org/images/stories/documents/intercalibration/Cookbook.pdf</a>). Sample bottles were stored in weak (~0.1 N) HNO<span style="font-size:10.8333px">3</span>, and were emptied before shipping.</p><p>Samples were collected using the U.S. GEOTRACES sampling system of 24 Teflon-coated GO-FLO bottles (Cutter and Bruland, 2012). At each station, the bottles were deployed open and tripped on ascent at 3 m/min. GO-FLOs were sampled in the GEOTRACES trace metal clean sampling van that contained HEPA-filtered air.</p><p>During sampling, the GO-FLO bottles were pressurized to ~0.4 atm with HEPA-filtered air, and their spigots were fitted with an acid-cleaned piece of Bev-a-Line tubing that fed into an Acropak-200 Supor capsule filter (0.2 µm pore size made of polyethersulfone). Before use, this filter had been filled with filtered surface seawater that had been acidifed to pH 2 with trace metal clean HCl and left overnight to rinse. Before collecting any subsamples, at least 500mL of seawater was passed through the filter (while eliminating air bubbles in the capsule reservoir). Sample bottles were rinsed three times with 10% sample volume before filling. Acropak filters were used for at most 3 casts before a new filter was used, and they were stored empty in a refrigerator while not in use. GEOFish surface samples were taken using an all-plastic "towed fish" pumping system as described in Bruland et al. 2005 at approximately 3 m depth and were similarly filtered and sampled.</p><p>Samples were acidified at sea with the equivalent of 4mL quartz-distilled 6M HCl per liter of seawater (resulting in pH 1.7-1.8). Samples were sitting acidified for several months before analysis back in the laboratory.</p><p><strong>Analysis:</strong></p><p>Samples were analyzed using the method of Ndung’u et. al. (2003) with adaptations from Zurbrick, et. al. (2013). Aliquots of samples are poured in to 15mL LDPE bottles for analysis. Samples, blanks, reference materials and standards are all treated equally. They are buffered with trace metal clean ammonium acetate (pH 9) in line and sent across a Toyopearl AF-Chelate 650 M resin column. The column is rinsed with diluted ammonium acetate, and eluted in 1.5N quartz distilled nitric acid (with added bismuth as an internal standard) into the injector of the HR-ICP-MS. Counts of lead are measured throughout the elution, yielding a curve which is then integrated to give our raw values.</p><p>Standards are made by spiking lead into low concentration seawater. Blanks are 24mL HCl in Milli-Q. Reference materials used were SAFe S1, SAFe D2, and GEOTRACES reference samples GS and GD. Standard curves are run at the beginning and the end of runs and reference materials and blanks are run throughout (every 10 or less samples).</p>

<p><strong>Flegal Lab Processing:</strong></p><p>For every sample, standard, blank and reference, we integrate an elution peak. We used a seawater standard calibration curve for lead. We subtracted a process blank from every sample. We checked that reference samples analyzed and processed in the same way resulted in reasonable values.</p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing:</strong><br />- added conventional header with dataset name, PI name, version date<br />- renamed parameter names&nbsp;to GEOTRACES standard naming conventions<br />- edited Pb conc. values from 14 decimal precision to 2 decimal precision.<br />- split GeoFish samples into a separate column from GO-FLO bottle samples.<br />- sample values&nbsp;were place in station order for all sample numbers.<br />- nominal depth for GeoFish samples was edited from 'surface' to 3.5 meters<br />- removed one duplicate sample (8346)&nbsp;entered as both a bottle and GeoFish sample (master event and GeoFish cast logs confirmed the sample to be from GeoFish, therefore&nbsp;the bottle entry was deleted).<br />- added columns by joining the submitted data with an Events Master file (see Additional GEOTRACES Processing).</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong></p><p>As was done for the GEOTRACES-NAT data, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters:</p><p>cruise_id, EXPOCODE,SECT_ID, STNNBR, CASTNO, GEOTRC_EVENTNO, GEOTRC_SAMPNO, GEOTRC_INSTR, SAMPNO, GF_NO, BTLNBR, BTLNBR_FLAG_W, DATE_START_EVENT, TIME_START_EVENT, ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT, EVENT_LAT, EVENT_LON, DEPTH_MIN, DEPTH_MAX, &nbsp;BTL_DATE, BTL_TIME, BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC, BTL_LAT, BTL_LON, ODF_CTDPRS, SMDEPTH, FMDEPTH, BTMDEPTH, CTDPRS, CTDDEPTH.</p><p>This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle and ODF_Bottle datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the TN303 Event Log (version 30 Oct 2014). Where applicable, pump information was taken from the PUMP_Nuts_Sals dataset.</p><p>A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.</p><p>If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.</p><p>See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
